first_reading.title: Book of Jeremiah
first_reading.text:
[[Jr 1,1]]The words of Jeremiah, son of Hilkiah, of a priestly family in Anathoth, in the land of Benjamin.
[[Jr 1,4]]The word of the LORD came to me thus:
[[Jr 1,5]]Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, before you were born I dedicated you, a prophet to the nations I appointed you.
[[Jr 1,6]]"Ah, Lord GOD!" I said, "I know not how to speak; I am too young."
[[Jr 1,7]]But the LORD answered me, Say not, "I am too young." To whomever I send you, you shall go; whatever I command you, you shall speak.
[[Jr 1,8]]Have no fear before them, because I am with you to deliver you, says the LORD.
[[Jr 1,9]]Then the LORD extended his hand and touched my mouth, saying, See, I place my words in your mouth!
[[Jr 1,10]]This day I set you over nations and over kingdoms, To root up and to tear down, to destroy and to demolish, to build and to plant.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 71,1]]In you, LORD, I take refuge; 
let me never be put to shame.
[[Ps 71,2]]In your justice rescue and deliver me; 
incline your ear to me, and save me.

[[Ps 71,3]]Be my rock of refuge, 
a stronghold to give me safety, 
for you are my rock and my fortress.
[[Ps 71,4a]]O my God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked.

[[Ps 71,5]]For you are my hope, O Lord; 
my trust, O God, from my youth.
[[Ps 71,6a]]On you I depend from birth;
[[Ps 71,6b]]from my mother's womb you are my strength.

[[Ps 71,15a]]My mouth shall declare your justice,
[[Ps 71,15b]]day by day your salvation.
[[Ps 71,17]]O God, you have taught me from my youth, 
and till the present I proclaim your wondrous deeds.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 13,1]]On that day, Jesus went out of the house and sat down by the sea.
[[Mt 13,2]]Such large crowds gathered around him that he got into a boat and sat down, and the whole crowd stood along the shore.
[[Mt 13,3]]And he spoke to them at length in parables, saying: "A sower went out to sow.
[[Mt 13,4]]And as he sowed, some seed fell on the path, and birds came and ate it up.
[[Mt 13,5]]Some fell on rocky ground, where it had little soil. It sprang up at once because the soil was not deep,
[[Mt 13,6]]and when the sun rose it was scorched, and it withered for lack of roots.
[[Mt 13,7]]Some seed fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it.
[[Mt 13,8]]But some seed fell on rich soil, and produced fruit, a hundred or sixty or thirtyfold.
[[Mt 13,9]]Whoever has ears ought to hear."
